intro: Wulffia trujilloi, commonly known as the Trujillo's wulffia, is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the Andean region of Peru. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species like willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy stems, typical of many members of its family. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or moist soil conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Wulffia trujilloi is considered a species of conservation concern.
